overview: Leo has spent the past 20 years building companies and technology that enable businesses and consumers to more easily interact through Internet and mobile technologies. During this time, he built his first company, Clara Vista, which was acquired by CMGI in 1999. Later, he co-founded the service Pickle.com, which was acquired by Scripps Networks in 2007. He has worked on a diverse array of technologies and development efforts including TV Everywhere, enterprise financial portfolio management systems, US Postal Service logistics platforms, telecommunication bill presentment, and satellite guidance and telemetry processing efforts. He holds a BS in electrical and computer engineering from Carnegie Mellon and an MS in computer science.
